title.narrative: Improving the Livelihoods of Youth in Gaza: Remote Employment and Virtual Jobs Training Program, Phase II

description.narrative:
1) 150 youth will be recruited and selecteed for PEFE's Job Training and Placement program. An expected 135 youth (90%) will graduate from the training, and 81 youth (60%) will be placed into internships and/or jobs within six months of graudation. This may include virtual jobs placement following a market assessment report recommendations.
2) 5 university partnerships will be created in Gaza for implementation of EFE's workforce readiness "Finding a Job is a Job" training (proposed university partners include: Al-Azhar University, University of Palestine (Gaza), University of College & Applied Sciences, Polytechnic University of Gaza)
3) 15 professors and administrators are trained on the "Finding a Job is a Job" training.
4) 600 university students complete "Finding a Job is a Job" trianing. This includes direct training classes, take-home exercises and activities, ongoing group career counselling sessions and individual career coaching sessions.
5) 6 alumni events are held to facilitate networking for graduates. (2 networking events and 4 civic engagement events)
Facilitate livelihood opportunities and access to virtual jobs for youth in Gaza

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

description.narrative: Gaza, West Bank and Gaza (admin level 1)
